metadata.title: CVE-2023-5972 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
A null pointer dereference flaw was found in the nft_inner.c functionalityof netfilter in the Linux kernel. This issue could allow a local user tocrash the system or escalate their privileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5972` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.6.0-14-generic - 6.6.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-generic - 6.6.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-generic-64k - 6.6.0-14.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.6.0-14.14').
linux-aws package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-azure package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-gcp package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-gke package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
linux-ibm package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-lowlatency package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-oracle package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-raspi package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-oem-6.8 package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
